e0a676072ad63194ba1110210357175e3c0e8925.question: How do I create an account?

response.answer: To create an organization account in HRCare, visit the signup page and provide your organization’s legal name, billing contact, and relevant tax information. Designate an initial admin who will have full access to configure users, roles, integrations, and system-wide policies. Small teams can self-serve entirely online, completing all steps without assistance, while enterprise customers requiring SSO integration, sandbox testing, or migration of legacy data should contact Sales for guided support.

context_used.content: To create an organization account in HRCare, visit the signup page and provide your organization’s legal name, billing contact, and relevant tax information. Designate an initial admin who will have full access to configure users, roles, integrations, and system-wide policies. Small teams can self-serve entirely online, completing all steps without assistance, while enterprise customers requiring SSO integration, sandbox testing, or migration of legacy data should contact Sales for guided support

. Once the account is created, the admin can set default permissions, add users, configure approval workflows, and enforce compliance rules such as password policies, IP restrictions, and session timeout rules. Automated confirmation emails and detailed step-by-step instructions guide new admins through account setup. HRCare ensures seamless onboarding, secure access, and alignment with organizational policies. Admins also receive notifications for account activities and system updates, helping maintain oversight and compliance

Admins can invite new users to HRCare by navigating to Settings → Users → Invite. Invitations require the recipient’s email and an assigned role. Role templates include Admin, HR Manager, Manager, Employee, or custom roles configured under Settings → Roles. Admins can define access limits for sensitive features, such as payroll, performance management, and reporting tools. Invited users complete their profile, set a secure password, and optionally enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for additional protection. Automated reminders notify users of pending invitations, reducing delays

response.answer: I don't have enough information in the knowledge base to answer your question. Please try rephrasing your question or contact support for assistance.

To handle onboarding effectively, you can use HRCare onboarding templates to automate paperwork, IT requests, benefits enrollment, and orientation tasks. These templates allow managers and IT teams to track completion through checklists and automated reminders, ensuring compliance and a smooth onboarding process. Additionally, you can customize onboarding templates based on department, location, role, or employment type, ensuring that employees receive relevant tasks and documentation.

context_used.content: HRCare onboarding templates automate paperwork, IT requests, benefits enrollment, and orientation tasks. Managers and IT teams can track completion via checklists and automated reminders, ensuring compliance and smooth onboarding.
Onboarding templates can be customized based on department, location, role, or employment type. Conditional assignment ensures that employees receive relevant tasks and documentation.

. Automated reminders notify users of pending invitations, reducing delays. Bulk invitation options, including CSV imports, simplify onboarding for larger teams. Every invitation action is logged to ensure auditability and compliance with organizational policies. This process ensures that employees receive the correct access, onboarding is efficient, and security standards are consistently applied. Admins can also revoke or reassign invitations if necessary, maintaining control over organizational access.
